gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.intro: RIVO Server is a backend platform for IoT robot fleet management. It provides a robust, high-performance Go-based backend to manage your robot fleet efficiently.
gettingStarted.note: Note: This guide is for operators, DevOps engineers, and integration developers. It covers deployment, configuration, and API usage.
gettingStarted.feature1: Robot Registration & Monitoring - Track status and monitor health.
gettingStarted.feature2: Real-time Telemetry - Stream robot telemetry data (odometry, battery, sensors).
gettingStarted.feature3: Log Management - Collect and stream logs from robots in real-time.
gettingStarted.feature4: Alert System - Receive, acknowledge, and resolve robot alerts.
gettingStarted.feature5: Map Management - Upload and manage ROS maps with trajectory tracking.
gettingStarted.feature6: Command & Control - Send commands to robots via REST or WebSocket.
gettingStarted.section2Intro: The release package contains the following structure:
gettingStarted.step1Note: The server will automatically create database tables and load schemas.
gettingStarted.step2Desc: Check if the server is healthy:
gettingStarted.step3Desc: Use the admin tool to create your initial account:

apiGuide.title: API Usage Guide
apiGuide.intro: All protected API endpoints require an Authorization header with a Bearer Token.
apiGuide.authDesc: Obtain Access Token and Refresh Token via the login API.
apiGuide.robotDesc: Register a new robot to the fleet.
apiGuide.statusDesc: Periodically update robot status (heartbeat, position, battery).
apiGuide.controlDesc: Send action commands to robots via REST.

customSchemas.title: Custom Message Schemas
customSchemas.intro: RIVO allows you to extend the API interface via JSON Schema. This enables robots to send custom-format data without modifying server code.
customSchemas.dirDesc: All schema files are stored in the custom_msg/ directory. The manifest file determines which schemas are loaded.
customSchemas.step1: Create a JSON file (following JSON Schema Draft-07 format).
customSchemas.result: The new API endpoint will automatically map to /api/v1/robots/{id}/<schema_id>.

deploymentConfig.title: Deployment & Configuration
deploymentConfig.dockerDesc: Docker is the recommended way to deploy RIVO Server in production.
deploymentConfig.dockerRun: Run with the required environment variables:
deploymentConfig.binaryDesc: Can run directly on Linux, macOS, or Windows. On Linux, systemd is recommended for daemon management.
deploymentConfig.configDesc: RIVO can be configured via config.yaml file or environment variables (prefixed with RIVO_).

advanced.title: Security & Maintenance
advanced.security1: JWT Keys: Ensure access_secret and refresh_secret are at least 32 characters long.
advanced.security2: HTTPS: In production, use a reverse proxy (Nginx or Caddy) with TLS encryption.
advanced.security3: Rate Limiting: Enable built-in rate limiting to prevent brute-force attacks.
advanced.security4: Field Encryption: Use security.encryption_key to encrypt sensitive data in the database.
advanced.monitorDesc: Monitor system health via the /health endpoint.
advanced.logDesc: Logs are automatically rotated daily and stored in the logs/ folder. Set logging.level to debug for detailed traces.
advanced.backupDesc: For SQLite, directly backup the data/rivo.db file. For PostgreSQL, use pg_dump for regular backups.

token.solution: Use the Refresh Token to obtain a new Access Token via /api/v1/auth/refresh.

connection.cause: Server not running, wrong port, or firewall blocking.
connection.solution: Check if the process is running and verify server.port in config.yaml.

database.solution: Verify the database DSN and ensure the database service or file is accessible.

ratelimit.cause: Too many requests from a single IP.
ratelimit.solution: Implement exponential backoff retry on the client, or adjust requests_per_second in config.

protocolCreator.title: RIVO Node Protocol Creator
protocolCreator.intro: Create sensor protocol files through a friendly interface. Choose Form Mode for quick configuration or Node Editor for complex data processing flows.
protocolCreator.instructions: Instructions: Fill out the form below and the system will automatically generate a YAML protocol file. Click "Download Protocol File" when complete.
protocolCreator.step1Desc: Configure sensor identification and communication method
protocolCreator.sensorIdHelp: Unique identifier, recommended lowercase with hyphens
protocolCreator.whoamiRegHelp: Register used to confirm device identity
protocolCreator.whoamiValueHelp: Expected return value when reading this register
protocolCreator.step3Desc: Define data points to read from the sensor
protocolCreator.step4Desc: Configure how data maps to RIVO system
protocolCreator.yamlPlaceholder: # Please fill out the form above to generate YAML configuration

palette.sensorInputDesc: Read raw sensor data from register
